register.description: Power Control Register - Write Only Register, Always Read as 0

bitfield.description: Conversion Clock is ON during STOP Mode
Conversion Clock is ON during RUN Mode

The SYSCTL interrupt index (IIDX) register generates a value corresponding to the highest priority pending interrupt source. This value may be used as an address offset for fast, deterministic handling in the interrupt service routine. A read of the IIDX register will clear the corresponding interrupt status in the RIS and MIS registers.
Enable or disable the LFOSCGOOD interrupt. LFOSCGOOD indicates that the LFOSC has started successfully.
Raw status of the LFOSCGOOD interrupt.
Masked status of the LFOSCGOOD interrupt.

The NMI interrupt index (NMIIIDX) register generates a value corresponding to the highest priority pending NMI source. This value may be used as an address offset for fast, deterministic handling in the NMI service routine. A read of the NMIIIDX register will clear the corresponding interrupt status in the NMIRIS register.
Raw status of the BORLVL NMI
USE4MHZSTOP sets the SYSOSC stop mode frequency policy. When entering STOP mode, the SYSOSC frequency may be automatically switched to 4MHz to reduce SYSOSC power consumption.

bitenum.description: Do not gear shift the SYSOSC to 4MHz in STOP mode
Gear shift SYSOSC to 4MHz in STOP mode

bitfield.description: DISABLESTOP sets the SYSOSC stop mode enable/disable policy. When operating in STOP mode, the SYSOSC may be automatically disabled. When set, ULPCLK will run from LFCLK in STOP mode and SYSOSC will be disabled to reduce power consumption.

bitenum.description: Do not disable SYSOSC in STOP mode
Disable SYSOSC in STOP mode and source ULPCLK from LFCLK

bitfield.description: BLOCKASYNCALL may be used to mask block all asynchronous fast clock requests, preventing hardware from dynamically changing the active clock configuration when operating in a given mode.

bitenum.description: Asynchronous fast clock requests are controlled by the requesting peripheral
All asynchronous fast clock requests are blocked

bitfield.description: DISABLE sets the SYSOSC enable/disable policy. SYSOSC may be powered off in RUN, SLEEP, and STOP modes to reduce power consumption. When SYSOSC is disabled, MCLK and ULPCLK are sourced from LFCLK.

bitenum.description: Disable SYSOSC immediately and source MCLK and ULPCLK from LFCLK

bitfield.description: FASTCPUEVENT may be used to assert a fast clock request when an interrupt is asserted to the CPU, reducing interrupt latency.

bitenum.description: An interrupt to the CPU will not assert a fast clock request
An interrupt to the CPU will assert a fast clock request

bitfield.description: Target operating frequency for the system oscillator (SYSOSC)
USEMFTICK specifies whether the 4MHz constant-rate clock (MFCLK) to peripherals is enabled or disabled. When enabled, MDIV must be disabled (set to 0h=/1).

bitenum.description: The 4MHz rate MFCLK to peripherals is enabled
The 4MHz rate MFCLK to peripherals is enabled.

bitfield.description: MDIV may be used to divide the MCLK frequency when MCLK is sourced from SYSOSC. MDIV=0h corresponds to /1 (no divider). MDIV=1h corresponds to /2 (divide-by-2). MDIV=Fh corresponds to /16 (divide-by-16). MDIV may be set between /1 and /16 on an integer basis.
USEHSCLK, together with USELFCLK, sets the MCLK source policy. Set USEHSCLK to use HSCLK (HFCLK or SYSPLL) as the MCLK source in RUN and SLEEP modes.

bitenum.description: MCLK will not use the high speed clock (HSCLK)
MCLK will use the high speed clock (HSCLK) in RUN and SLEEP mode

bitfield.description: USELFCLK sets the MCLK source policy. Set USELFCLK to use LFCLK as the MCLK source. Note that setting USELFCLK does not disable SYSOSC, and SYSOSC remains available for direct use by analog modules.

bitenum.description: MCLK will not use the low frequency clock (LFCLK)
MCLK will use the low frequency clock (LFCLK)

bitfield.description: STOPCLKSTBY sets the STANDBY mode policy (STANDBY0 or STANDBY1). When set, ULPCLK and LFCLK are disabled to all peripherals in STANDBY mode, with the exception of TIMG0 and TIMG1 which continue to run. Wake-up is only possible via an asynchronous fast clock request.

bitenum.description: ULPCLK/LFCLK runs to all PD0 peripherals in STANDBY mode
ULPCLK/LFCLK is disabled to all peripherals in STANDBY mode except TIMG0 and TIMG1

bitfield.description: FLASHWAIT specifies the number of flash wait states when MCLK is sourced from HSCLK. FLASHWAIT has no effect when MCLK is sourced from SYSOSC or LFCLK.

bitenum.description: No flash wait states are applied
One flash wait state is applied

bitfield.description: MCLKDEADCHK enables or disables the continuous MCLK dead check monitor. LFCLK must be running before MCLKDEADCHK is enabled.

bitenum.description: The MCLK dead check monitor is disabled
The MCLK dead check monitor is enabled

bitfield.description: UDIV specifies the ULPCLK divider when MCLK is sourced from HSCLK. UDIV has no effect when MCLK is sourced from SYSOSC or LFCLK.

bitenum.description: ULPCLK is not divided and is equal to MCLK

bitfield.description: HFXTEN enables or disables the high frequency crystal oscillator (HFXT).
USEEXTHFCLK selects the HFCLK_IN digital clock input to be the source for HFCLK. When disabled, HFXT is the HFCLK source and HFXTEN may be set. Do not set HFXTEN and USEEXTHFCLK simultaneously.

bitenum.description: Use HFXT as the HFCLK source
Use the HFCLK_IN digital clock input as the HFCLK source

bitfield.description: SYSPLLEN enables or disables the system phase-lock loop (SYSPLL).
HSCLKSEL selects the HSCLK source (SYSPLL or HFCLK).

bitenum.description: HSCLK is sourced from the SYSPLL
HSCLK is sourced from the HFCLK

bitfield.description: HFXTTIME specifies the HFXT startup time in 64us resolution. If the HFCLK startup monitor is enabled (HFCLKFLTCHK), HFXT will be checked after this time expires.
HFCLKFLTCHK enables or disables the HFCLK startup monitor.
XT1DRIVE selects the low frequency crystal oscillator (LFXT) drive strength.
MONITOR enables or disables the LFCLK monitor, which continuously checks LFXT or LFCLK_IN for a clock stuck fault.
LOWCAP controls the low-power LFXT mode. When the LFXT load capacitance is less than 3pf, LOWCAP may be set for reduced power consumption.

bitenum.description: LFXT low capacitance mode is disabled
LFXT low capacitance mode is enabled

bitfield.description: ENABLECLK0 enables or disables the SYSPLLCLK0 output.
ENABLECLK1 enables or disables the SYSPLLCLK1 output.
RDIVCLK1 sets the final divider for the SYSPLLCLK1 output.
MCLK2XVCO selects the SYSPLL output which is sent to the HSCLK mux for use by MCLK.

bitenum.description: The SYSPLLCLK0 output is sent to the HSCLK mux
The SYSPLLCLK2X output is sent to the HSCLK mux

bitfield.description: RDIVCLK2X sets the final divider for the SYSPLLCLK2X output.
RDIVCLK0 sets the final divider for the SYSPLLCLK0 output.
SYSPLLREF selects the system PLL (SYSPLL) reference clock source.
ENABLECLK2X enables or disables the SYSPLLCLK2X output.
PDIV selects the SYSPLL reference clock prescale divider.
QDIV selects the SYSPLL feedback path divider.

bitenum.description: Divide-by-one is not a valid QDIV option

bitfield.description: CAPBOVERRIDE controls the override for Cap B
Startup time from enable to locked clock, in 1us resolution
Startup time from low power mode exit to locked clock, in 1us resolution
HFCLK4MFPCLKDIV selects the divider applied to HFCLK when HFCLK is used as the MFPCLK source. Integer dividers from /1 to /16 may be selected.

bitenum.description: HFCLK is not divided before being used for MFPCLK
HFCLK is divided by 2 before being used for MFPCLK
HFCLK is divided by 3 before being used for MFPCLK
HFCLK is divided by 4 before being used for MFPCLK
HFCLK is divided by 5 before being used for MFPCLK
HFCLK is divided by 6 before being used for MFPCLK
HFCLK is divided by 7 before being used for MFPCLK
HFCLK is divided by 8 before being used for MFPCLK
HFCLK is divided by 9 before being used for MFPCLK
HFCLK is divided by 10 before being used for MFPCLK
HFCLK is divided by 11 before being used for MFPCLK
HFCLK is divided by 12 before being used for MFPCLK
HFCLK is divided by 13 before being used for MFPCLK
HFCLK is divided by 14 before being used for MFPCLK
HFCLK is divided by 15 before being used for MFPCLK
HFCLK is divided by 16 before being used for MFPCLK

bitfield.description: MFPCLKSRC selects the MFPCLK (middle frequency precision clock) source.
FCCTRIGCNT specifies the number of trigger clock periods in the trigger window. FCCTRIGCNT=0h (one trigger clock period) up to 1Fh (32 trigger clock periods) may be specified.
ANACPUMPCFG selects the analog mux charge pump (VBOOST) enable method.

bitenum.description: VBOOST is enabled on request from a COMP, GPAMP, or OPA
VBOOST is enabled when the device is in RUN or SLEEP mode, or when a COMP/GPAMP/OPA is enabled

bitfield.description: FCCSELCLK selectes the frequency clock counter (FCC) clock source.

bitenum.description: FCC clock is the CLK_OUT selection
FCC clock is the FCCIN external input

bitfield.description: FCCTRIGSRC selects the frequency clock counter (FCC) trigger source.

bitenum.description: FCC trigger is the external pin

bitfield.description: FCCLVLTRIG selects the frequency clock counter (FCC) trigger mode.

bitenum.description: Rising edge to rising edge triggered

bitfield.description: EXCLKSRC selects the source for the CLK_OUT external clock output block. ULPCLK and MFPCLK require the CLK_OUT divider (EXCLKDIVEN) to be enabled

bitenum.description: CLK_OUT is ULPCLK (EXCLKDIVEN must be enabled)
CLK_OUT is MFPCLK (EXCLKDIVEN must be enabled)

bitfield.description: EXCLKDIVVAL selects the divider value for the divider in the CLK_OUT external clock output block.
EXCLKDIVEN enables or disables the divider function of the CLK_OUT external clock output block.

bitenum.description: CLock divider is disabled (passthrough, EXCLKDIVVAL is not applied)
Clock divider is enabled (EXCLKDIVVAL is applied)

bitfield.description: EXCLKEN enables the CLK_OUT external clock output block.
MFPCLKEN enables the middle frequency precision clock (MFPCLK).
DSLEEP selects the operating mode to enter upon a DEEPSLEEP request from the CPU.
RESCOARSE specifies the resister coarse trim. This value changes with the target frequency.
RESFINE specifies the resister fine trim. This value changes with the target frequency.
RDIV specifies the frequency correction loop (FCL) resistor trim. This value changes with the target frequency.
FREQ specifies the target user-trimmed frequency for SYSOSC.
CAP specifies the SYSOSC capacitor trim. This value changes with the target frequency.

SRAM boundary configuration. The value configured into this acts such that: SRAM accesses to addresses less than or equal value will be RW only. SRAM accesses to addresses greater than value will be RX only. Value of 0 is not valid (system will have no stack). If set to 0, the system acts as if the entire SRAM is RWX. Any non-zero value can be configured, including a value = SRAM size.
FLASHECCRSTDIS specifies whether a flash ECC double error detect (DED) will trigger a SYSRST or an NMI.

bitenum.description: Flash ECC DED will trigger a SYSRST
Flash ECC DED will trigger a NMI

bitfield.description: WWDTLP0RSTDIS specifies whether a WWDT Error Event will trigger a BOOTRST or an NMI.

bitenum.description: WWDTLP0 Error Event will trigger a BOOTRST
WWDTLP0 Error Event will trigger an NMI

bitfield.description: WWDTLP1RSTDIS specifies whether a WWDT Error Event will trigger a SYSRST or an NMI.

bitenum.description: WWDTLP1 Error Event will trigger a SYSRST
WWDTLP1 Error Event will trigger an NMI

bitfield.description: ACTIVE controls whether critical SYSCTL registers are write protected or not.
OPAMPCLKERR is set when the device clock configuration does not support an enabled OPA mode and the OPA may not be functioning as expected.

bitenum.description: No OPA clock generation errors detected

bitfield.description: LFOSCGOOD indicates when the LFOSC startup has completed and the LFOSC is ready for use.

HFCLKGOOD indicates that the HFCLK started correctly. When the HFXT is started or HFCLK_IN is selected as the HFCLK source, this bit will be set by hardware if a valid HFCLK is detected, and cleared if HFCLK is not operating within the expected range.
HSCLKDEAD is set by hardware if the selected source for HSCLK was started but did not start successfully.

bitenum.description: The HSCLK source was not started or started correctly
The HSCLK source did not start correctly

bitfield.description: SYSPLLBLKUPD indicates when writes to SYSPLLCFG0/1 and SYSPLLPARAM0/1 are blocked.

bitenum.description: writes to SYSPLLCFG0/1 and SYSPLLPARAM0/1 are allowed
writes to SYSPLLCFG0/1 and SYSPLLPARAM0/1 are blocked

bitfield.description: HFCLKOFF indicates if the HFCLK is disabled or was dead at startup. When the HFCLK is started, HFCLKOFF is cleared by hardware. Following startup of the HFCLK, if the HFCLK startup monitor determines that the HFCLK was not started correctly, HFCLKOFF is set.

bitenum.description: HFCLK started correctly and is enabled
HFCLK is disabled or was dead at startup

bitfield.description: HFCLKBLKUPD indicates when writes to the HFCLKCLKCFG register are blocked.
HSCLKGOOD is set by hardware if the selected clock source for HSCLK started successfully.

bitenum.description: The HSCLK source did not start correctly

bitfield.description: SYSPLLGOOD indicates if the SYSPLL started correctly. When the SYSPLL is started, SYSPLLGOOD is cleared by hardware. After the startup settling time has expired, the SYSPLL status is tested. If the SYSPLL started successfully the SYSPLLGOOD bit is set, else it is left cleared.
ANACLKERR is set when the device clock configuration does not support an enabled analog peripheral mode and the analog peripheral may not be functioning as expected.
HSCLKMUX indicates if MCLK is currently sourced from the high-speed clock (HSCLK).

bitenum.description: MCLK is not sourced from HSCLK

bitfield.description: LFCLKMUX indicates if LFCLK is sourced from the internal LFOSC, the low frequency crystal (LFXT), or the LFCLK_IN digital clock input.

bitenum.description: LFCLK is sourced from the internal LFOSC
LFCLK is sourced from the LFXT (crystal)
LFCLK is sourced from LFCLK_IN (external digital clock input)

bitfield.description: SYSOSCFREQ indicates the current SYSOSC operating frequency.

bitenum.description: SYSOSC is at the user-trimmed frequency (16 or 24MHz)

bitfield.description: LFXTGOOD indicates if the LFXT started correctly. When the LFXT is started, LFXTGOOD is cleared by hardware. After the startup settling time has expired, the LFXT status is tested. If the LFXT started successfully the LFXTGOOD bit is set, else it is left cleared.
HSCLKSOFF is set when the high speed clock sources (SYSPLL, HFCLK) are disabled or dead. It is the logical AND of HFCLKOFF and SYSPLLOFF.

bitenum.description: SYSPLL, HFCLK, or both were started correctly and remain enabled
SYSPLL and HFCLK are both either off or dead

bitfield.description: FCLMODE indicates if the SYSOSC frequency correction loop (FCL) is enabled.
CURHSCLKSEL indicates the current clock source for HSCLK.

bitenum.description: HSCLK is currently sourced from the SYSPLL
HSCLK is currently sourced from the HFCLK

bitfield.description: CURMCLKSEL indicates if MCLK is currently sourced from LFCLK.

bitenum.description: MCLK is not sourced from LFCLK

bitfield.description: FCCDONE indicates when a frequency clock counter capture is complete.

SYSPLLOFF indicates if the SYSPLL is disabled or was dead at startup. When the SYSPLL is started, SYSPLLOFF is cleared by hardware. Following startup of the SYSPLL, if the SYSPLL startup monitor determines that the SYSPLL was not started correctly, SYSPLLOFF is set.

bitenum.description: SYSPLL started correctly and is enabled
SYSPLL is disabled or was dead startup

bitfield.description: LFCLKFAIL indicates when the continous LFCLK monitor detects a LFXT or LFCLK_IN clock stuck failure.
SHDNIOLOCK indicates when IO is locked due to SHUTDOWN

bitenum.description: IO IS NOT Locked due to SHUTDOWN
IO IS Locked due to SHUTDOWN

bitfield.description: EXTRSTPINDIS indicates when user has disabled the use of external reset pin
PMUIREFGOOD is set by hardware when the PMU current reference is ready.
SWDCFGDIS indicates when user has disabled the use of SWD Port
ANACPUMPGOOD is set by hardware when the VBOOST analog mux charge pump is ready.
REBOOTATTEMPTS indicates the number of boot attempts taken before the user application starts.
BORLVL indicates if a BOR event occured and the BOR threshold was switched to BOR0 by hardware.

bitenum.description: A BOR violation occured and the BOR threshold was switched to BOR0

bitfield.description: MCAN0READY indicates when the MCAN0 peripheral is ready.
FLASHDED indicates if a flash ECC double bit error was detected (DED).

bitenum.description: No flash ECC double bit error detected
Flash ECC double bit error detected

bitfield.description: FLASHSEC indicates if a flash ECC single bit error was detected and corrected (SEC).

bitenum.description: No flash ECC single bit error detected
Flash ECC single bit error was detected and corrected

bitfield.description: BORCURTHRESHOLD indicates the active brown-out reset supply monitor configuration.

bitenum.description: Default minimum threshold; a BOR0- violation triggers a BOR
A BOR1- violation generates a BORLVL interrupt
A BOR2- violation generates a BORLVL interrupt
A BOR3- violation generates a BORLVL interrupt

bitfield.description: ID is a read-to-clear field which indicates the lowest level reset cause since the last read.

bitenum.description: POR- violation, SHUTDNSTOREx or PMU trim parity fault

register.description: Reset level for application-triggered reset command

bitfield.description: LEVEL is used to specify the type of reset to be issued when RESETCMD is set to generate a software triggered reset.

bitenum.description: Issue a SYSRST (CPU plus peripherals only)
Issue a BOOTRST (CPU, peripherals, and boot configuration routine)
Issue a SYSRST and enter the boot strap loader (BSL)
Issue a SYSRST and exit the boot strap loader (BSL)

bitfield.description: Execute the reset specified in RESETLEVEL.LEVEL. Must be written together with the KEY.
LEVEL specifies the desired BOR threshold and BOR mode.

bitenum.description: Default minimum threshold; a BOR0- violation triggers a BOR
A BOR1- violation generates a BORLVL interrupt
A BOR2- violation generates a BORLVL interrupt
A BOR3- violation generates a BORLVL interrupt

bitfield.description: GO clears any prior BOR violation status indications and attempts to change the active BOR mode to that specified in the LEVEL field of the BORTHRESHOLD register.

register.description: SYSOSC frequency correction loop (FCL) ROSC enable

bitfield.description: Set SETUSEFCL to enable the frequency correction loop in SYSOSC. Once enabled, this state is locked until the next BOOTRST.
Set SETUSEEXRES to specify that an external resistor will be used for the FCL. An appropriate resistor must be populated on the ROSC pin. This state is locked until the next BOOTRST.
Set SETUSELFXT to switch LFCLK to LFXT. Once set, SETUSELFXT remains set until the next BOOTRST.

bitenum.description: Use LFXT as the LFCLK source

bitfield.description: Set STARTLFXT to start the low frequency crystal oscillator (LFXT). Once set, STARTLFXT remains set until the next BOOTRST.
Set SETUSEEXLF to switch LFCLK to the LFCLK_IN digital clock input. Once set, SETUSEEXLF remains set until the next BOOTRST.

bitenum.description: Use LFCLK_IN as the LFCLK source

bitfield.description: Set RELEASE to release the IO after a SHUTDOWN mode exit.

register.description: Disable the reset function of the NRST pin

bitfield.description: Set DISABLE to disable the reset function of the NRST pin. Once set, this configuration is locked until the next POR.

bitenum.description: Reset function of NRST pin is enabled
Reset function of NRST pin is disabled

bitfield.description: Set ALLECC to clear all ECC related SYSSTATUS indicators.

register.description: Disable the SWD function on the SWD pins

bitfield.description: Set DISABLE to disable the SWD function on SWD pins, allowing the SWD pins to be used as GPIO.

bitenum.description: Disable SWD function on SWD pins

bitfield.description: Set GO to start a capture with the frequency clock counter (FCC).
RRI selects the rail-to-rail input mode.
NSEL selects the GPAMP negative channel input.

bitenum.description: GPAMP_OUT pin connected to negative channel
GPAMP_IN- pin connected to negative channel
GPAMP_OUT signal connected to negative channel

bitfield.description: CHOPCLKMODE selects the GPAMP chopping mode.
Set OUTENABLE to connect the GPAMP output signal to the GPAMP_OUT pin

bitenum.description: GPAMP_OUT signal is not connected to the GPAMP_OUT pin
GPAMP_OUT signal is connected to the GPAMP_OUT pin

bitfield.description: Set ENABLE to turn on the GPAMP.
CHOPCLKFREQ selects the GPAMP chopping clock frequency
Set PCHENABLE to enable the positive channel input.

register.description: Power Control Register - Write Only Register, Always Read as 0

bitfield.description: Conversion Clock is ON during STOP Mode
Conversion Clock is ON during RUN Mode

register.description: Power Control Register - Write Only Register, Always Read as 0

bitfield.description: Async Clock Request is blocked from starting SYSOSC or forcing bus clock to 32MHz

register.description: Power Control Register - Write Only Register, Always Read as 0

bitfield.description: Async Clock Request is blocked from starting SYSOSC or forcing bus clock to 32MHz

bitfield.description: Async Clock Request is blocked from starting SYSOSC or forcing bus clock to 32MHz

Power Control Register - Write Only Register, Always Read as 0
Power Control Register - Write Only Register, Always Read as 0

Power Control Register - Write Only Register, Always Read as 0
